header.name: chaos/preprocessor/seq/variadic/fold_right_aux.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines an algorithm that accumulates the elements of a from the last element to the first element.

macro.abstract: The macro accumulates the elements of its second argument with the operation specified by its first argument.

param.para:
The operation that is to be used to accumulate the elements of seq. This operation must be either a or a macro name that refers to a macro with a signature compatible with the following pseudo-signature:
op(s, tuple, data†, state‡)

† If the auxiliary data is parenthetic, the data pseudo-parameter must be the number of parameters that corresponds to the number of sub-elements in the auxiliary data. Otherwise, it must be a single parameter.
‡ The state pseudo-parameter must be either ... or the number of parameters that corresponds to the number of arguments in the auxiliary data, __VA_ARGS__.

usage.param: The whose elements are to be accumulated.
Auxiliary data to be passed through the algorithm to the operation. This argument may be either a parenthetic expression of any arity or a non-parenthetic expression.
The initial state of the accumulation.

macro.para:
This macro behaves identically to except that each element is wrapped in parentheses prior to being passed to the operation. For example, instead of the operation being invoked as...
op(s, elem, data, state)
it is invoked as...
op(s, (elem), data, state)
